newsitem.title: SLOVENIA: Slovenian SBI index gains, outlook buoyant.
newsitem.headline: Slovenian SBI index gains, outlook buoyant.

text.p: The Slovenian SBI index closed up 0.64 percent on Friday as foreign activity kept pushing prices up. Traders forecast that the rise was likely to continue over the summer.
"Over the summer traders will most probably be very busy, much more than we previously expected," said Nena Jarc, a trader at Nova Ljubljanska banka.
But she said some profit-taking was to be expected over the short term.
The SBI index rose 9.14 points or 0.64 percent to 1,440.2. This week the index fell 1.36 percent after last week's jump of over 15 percent.
Market participants forecast the blue-chip index could rise about 20 percent by autumn if foreign portfolio investors remain as active as they are.
Overall 12 shares rose, five fell and two were flat while nine were untraded. Turnover fell to 255.0 million tolars from 430.4 million.
Pharmaceutical wholesaler Salus was the top gainer, jumping 11.38 percent to 14,490 tolars on volume of only 10 shares.
Market participants attributed the rise to a technical correction after recent losses in the share.
Trading company Kovinotehna was the most active, jumping 5.83 percent to 436 tolars on volume of 10,320 shares.
"Kovinotehna is one of the shares which did not rise much over recent days and brokers are obviously searching for an alternative investment," one broker said.
Hipotekarna banka Brezice led decliners, falling 2.44 percent to 4,000 tolars on volume of 575 shares.
Drug maker Lek had the day's highest turnover, rising 1.73 percent to 33,500 tolars on volume of 3,396 shares for total turnover of 112.3 million tolars
